Reviews.Content: Hotel overrated but superb location Stayed at the Palacio Retiro for 3 nights,after booking the rooms through a discounter website.First impressions, the location,central as can be, and the locality is safe which makes walking around in the area ,even if its late, reasonably safe.If you are selecting a hotel in Madrid purely on the basis of its location bar everything else, then there isnt much competition to this one!The hotel is a conversion from a relatively ancient ,possibly a historically significant building, the numbers of rooms are small, which is a bonus to those looking for personalised service.Facilities include a spa, and a relatively poor excuse for a gym(a treadmill, an exercise cycle with a broken pedal! and a weights machine crammed into a small room).Complimentary bottles of water crammed into the adjacent refrigerator is a plus though!Again my expectations in this review are based on the supposed class of the hotel , this is pitched as a 5 star plus hotel,I believe there are only ?6 hotels in this category in Madrid.There isnt a lobby to speak of as the conversion hasnt left much space on the ground floor.In attempting to create a unique character for this hotel,it is evident that the management has pitched it as a boutique hotel,ie the furnishings/decor.Unfortunately this contrasts with the understated appearance of the character of the building itself, the contrast at times does seem garish and inappropriate.Staff seem friendly enough although ill organised eg a blocked sink in the room remained so, for the 3 days of the stay despite numerous reminders to reception!Conclusions , if one is prepared to overlook everything else and pay top whack for a centrally located hotel,then this would seem an obvious choice,although on the whole this represents relatively less value for money.
Reviews.Author: JohnX3

Reviews.Content: Exceptional! Stay here if you can! What a pleasure to comment publicly on this exceptional hotel! My wife and I have stayed at many special hotels throughout Europe, luxury and otherwise. This hotel is a standout among the very finest! AC Palacio del Retiro is an impeccably restored palace in central Madrid, close to the Prado and across the street from Retiro Park. The interior of the hotel is minimalist high design and a truly beautiful blending of the old and new. We had a suite overlooking the park, which could not have been more lovely or comfortable. The staff is professional, friendly and present without being overbearing or standoffish. Everyone I encountered there spoke excellent English. My only complaint is that we budgeted much too little time there (two nights) because of other travel arrangements. I look forward to a return trip and would enthusiastically recommend this hotel to my friends and family.
Reviews.Author: dsbush

Reviews.Content: Good hotel but needs improvement Stayed twice in July at Palacio del Retiro..The property is tastefully designed, ie. modern decor in a beautiful historical building. You also cannot beat the location!!Some of the issues I had were that upon arrival (and this happened twice), there is no porter to take your bags and help you from the taxi inside. Several times when calling the front desk there was no answer.Once we had to actually go downstairs to communicate with them after having tried many times to reach them by phone.When ordering room service the wait times exceeded 45 minutes, mind you this was for coffee and cereal.They are helpful at the front desk and very friendly but they need to work out the kinks. No porters around and having problems calling front desk are NOT good business.
Reviews.Author: Jeffreyy

Reviews.Content: Brilliant Hotel This is such a fabulous hotel, great location, stunning building, terriffic staff. We stayed in a superior room which was nice and large with a great bathroom and a great big king size bed!. We had a room that looked on to an internal courtyard, so there was no road noise. The Spa/Sauna area downstairs is just AMAZING and the best thing for jet lag! A walk in Retiro Park across the road is a great way to start your day too. I would highly recommend at stay at this hotel. Everything was perfect!

My Brother three cousins myself and husbands/wives. We were treated like royalty, a brilliant way to celebrate our wedding anniversaries.

Reviews.Content: Everything perfect but the smoke! This is a great hotel to do with the quality of their rooms, the location is unbeatable and it feels almost like you were in your own house in the capital of spain, we really loved it, specially the personal service you receive form its staff, all of them made our stay unique. Only one thing we found quite surprising: THE SMOKE ALL OVER THE RECEPTION AREA AND EVEN IN OUR WAY TO OUR ROOM, RESTAURANT AND OTHER SUPPOSED TO BE NON SMOKING AREAS, In a country where is forbidden to smoke in common areas, children and non smokers in general are breathing this very same air... We were told that it was part of some works in the building and they had not quite finished yet. I HOPE THIS WILL BE COMPLETED MORE EFFICIENTLY OTHERWISE WOULD BE A PITY NOT TO TAKE ENOUGH ATTENTION IN A MATTER THIS NATURE...
Reviews.Author: schmidts

Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel My colleagues in Madrid booked the hotel for me, they put all company visitors there. The hotel room was exactly like the photos. Very modern. I was a bit worried after reading the reviews as I hate smoking rooms. But didn't smell anything at all. Very comfortable bed...luxurious deco, very clean. Oh I love the bath tub because I could lie in the bath tub and watched TV, not inside the bathroom but the angle of the bath made it possible, unlike all the hotels I have stayed before.Breakfast was a real treat but I wouldn't eat there if it wasn't paid by the company, at 30 Euros.Location was not center but I could walk to Plaza Mayor etc. leisurely. Metro Retiro was close by so it was convenient.Staff service was good. All spoke good English.

Reviews.Author: mikeboy

Reviews.Content: Highly recommended My husband and I have just returned from Madrid. We have traveled quite a bit and are very particular travelers. We have stayed in many wonderful hotels. This hotel is part of the Small Luxury Hotels of the World group that we often frequent. We had an excellent stay here. The staff were among the best staff we have every experienced. The location is perfect, across from the park and walking distance to virtually everything.Our room overlooked the park and had a separate sitting room with sofa and flat screen TV. There is a double door to block out the street noise. The wonderful bath had a double sink and shower room. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially if you like to walk to everything, as we do. It is located in a lovely neighborhood wiuth access to all the museums, great shopping and all that Madrid has to offer.
Reviews.Author: Sanfrancisco820

Reviews.Content: Good, but not Great considering the high price I stayed here as part of a group for a two-day meeting which was also held in the hotel so I got to know the place quite well. Overall the Palacio del Retiro tried hard but I still preferred my earlier nights stay in the vastly cheaper Avenida de America hotel under the same AC brand. The location of this hotel cannot be faulted - it is close to major tourist attractions such as the Prado and right next to the beautiful Retiro park. The hotel itself is a converted home of some ex-aristocracy and to me this (unfortunately) shows in its rather creepy general decor reminiscent of some kind of museum. The staff also seemed to think they were back in the days of the landed gentry, often straying well-beyond mere provision of polite friendly service into the realms of servile obsequiousness.My room was at the back with no view but this also means without the traffic noise at the front so that was OK with me. It was a large (for Madrid) room with flat-screen TV (not much English-speaking content) a CD player, and trademark free minibar. The very classy bathroom was similarly generously-sized with plenty of nice touches such as slippers, bathrobe, and about a dozen different items such as face creams and mouthwash.The spa area was well-appointed with items such as sauna, steamroom, and bubblepool - although sadly with non-working showers which was a bit of a dealbreaker after getting out of the sauna. There was also a cute-looking fitness room which I suspect real gym-freaks would consider inadequate, although I was impressed with its help-yourself fridge full of cold drinks. Oddly there is no locker area and we concluded you are supposed to change in your room then take the elevator in your bathrobe.I ate one dinner, two breakfasts, and several buffet snacks in the restaurant but as a vegetarian (practically against the law in Spain) I had no hope or expectation of getting decent food. My meat-eating companions said the quality was good however.A lot of money had obviously been spent on the furnishing of this hotel so it seems ungrateful not to like it. There was just too much inattention to detail though - the revolting smell of cigarettes hung strongly over the entire place, except for the lower floors where it was beaten back by the even stronger smell from the drains. Also for such an expensive establishment the trivial cost of improvements like non-slamming doors would not even be on the radar, instead of which I was repeatedly woken by endless bang bang bang. If I had been paying the room rate (seems to be well over 300 Euros +tax) out of my own money I would frankly have felt cheated.
Reviews.Author: ultrak3wl

Reviews.Content: Fantastic location I have family in Madrid, so when I chose this hotel I was familar with it's excellent central location; opposite the Retiro park, four minutes walk to the Prado museum, and five minutes to Calle Serrano, one of Madrid's best shopping streets, perfect!! It's also five minutes walk to Gran Via, and ten to Sol. We only took cabs when we were in a hurry, otherwise we walked everywhere. The hotel itself was fantastic, we loved the interior design; a fusion of modern and old, retaining the original palace's charm, whilst infusing some 21st century hipness. The staff were great. The room comfortable and peaceful. But room service was terribly overpriced, we got charged 6 Euros for a small jug of milk (for our tea- we are British after all!) and 8 euros for a small white bread salmon sandwich, which was appalling. We decided not to bother with the restaurant and headed out for breakfast ( 30 euros in the hotel) at one of the fantastic patisseries on Serrano, where I became obsessed with their coffee and croissants. All in all I would recommend this place, but it is quite pricey by Madrid standards. Avoid room service and you'll be fine!
Reviews.Author: SarahKJones

Reviews.Content: quiet, friendly staff, interesting decour My husband and I stayed at the AC Palacio del Retiro for a few days on our honeymoon. Overall, we liked the hotel. The hotel was VERY quiet while we were there. We never saw another guest (although it was August, which is a slow month). It is located across the street from a beautiful park and it is near the museums, but you need to take a cab into town where the action and the restaurants are. The staff were very friendly and helpful. My husband LOVED the modern style mixed with the ornate more traditional architecture, but I found the decour kind of creapy! The rooms are small and painted a dark grey which made them feel even smaller. There was little space to unpack (as we found to be the case in the 2 other hotels in madrid as well). The rooms have nice plasma tvs but have only about 2 English channels (which was also the case in the other hotels we stayed at in Spain). The bathroom was very roomy and modern with a huge shower and heated towel rack. However, our shower and one of the 2 sinks were clogged. When we complained the concierge sounded horrified but the problem was not repaired in the 2 remaining days we stayed at the hotel. Overall, we enjoyed our stay but switched hotels to be closer to town.I hope this is helpful to you. Have fun!
Reviews.Author: travelingnewlyweds

Reviews.Content: Some strengths but some big niggles! Stayed here with a colleague for a business trip and will start by listing positives.Excellent service, funky rooms and lovely location next to the park and museums. However, there were some very funny smells on our visit. The bar and reception area smelt strongly of drains to put it nicely which put us off out otherwise excellent cocktails. My colleagues room absolutely STANK of smoke which was replusive. The hotel does have a no smoking policy in rooms I believe but this had obviously been ignored and the room had not been aired at all.The restaurant was empty (even at 930/10, traditional time to have dinner in Madrid) but the food was good, a little bit heavy in some instances but again excellent service.Also disappointed that the much publicised spa does not have an inhouse masseur or treatment team and this has to be arranged in advance with the front desk.
Reviews.Author: alondonvisitor

Reviews.Content: modern comfort in a great location After an inauspicious stay at the Preciado and Villa Real, it was a relief to find a room in Madrid that felt clean and comfortable. The super-high ceilings add to the sense of space while in terms of actual square footage, our regular suite (325 euros) was modest at best. I was left to wonder if there is any material difference between the junior suite and the suite other than the price tag (junior suite is 277 eruos). However, all the junior suites were taken so we decided to spring for the regular suite. While we would have preferred a room on a higher floor, none (in our room type) was available so we settled for a suite facing the Retiro on the first floor. The layout of the suite was similar to what we've found in junior suites at most other hotels--that is to say, there is not a separate sitting room. It is one room that contains a large bed (or 2 generously sized twins), a sofa, coffee table, flat-screen tvs, cd player, a desk and (depending on the room) a dining table with chairs. There was also a spacious bathroom with a separate bath tub/shower and two sinks. Some rooms also come with a dressing room/walk-in closet.Our suite was outfitted with modern furniture and the color scheme was decidedly dark and masculine (greys, mahogany, black) which may, to some eye, clash with the belles epoch architecture of the building. For eg, the high ceiling which I noted earlier, was decorated with ornate, wedding-cake moldings of the period. What made our stay most comfortable was the bedding, the power shower, and the climate control system. The bed was perfect: not too hard to induce aches in the morning, and not too soft and the high-thread count sheets felt like cream against the skin. The air conditioner worked superbly with fine adjustments to suit your temperature preference.My main complaint is the traffic noise. If you decide to take a room facing the park (and thus, the very heavily trafficked Alfonso Xll) on a low floor, be prepared for the constant noise and occasional vibrations. The double windows help some, but in this regard I must say that the Hotel Preciado was far superior with their highly sound-proofed windows.About the restaurant: we had room service on two nights--the first night was fantastic and the second night was much less so. Different kitchen staff on different nights? Possibly. I just thought I'd note the inconsistency, especially with the seafood risotto, which on the second night came with lifeless, rubbery shrimp.Finally, the hotel staff is really wonderful. They speak English beautifully and are only happy to please.
Reviews.Author: Tranquila

Reviews.Content: Comfortable Hotel with room for improvement We stayed at the AC Palacio del Retiro in June for 4 nights. The hotel has a fabulous location. The hotel staff were very nice and quite helpful. Their recommendations for restaurants were good. The rooms were nicely appointed, though on the small side. We also enjoyed the turkish bath and jacuzzi area. I would however recomment that the hotel fix the noise problem created by room doors that seem to slam shut on each opening. I found my sleep interrupted more often than i liked by the doors of other rooms slamming shut. I would also recommend that the hotel offer an al la carte breakfast, as a fixed price of EURO 27 per person is not something most travellers are prepared to spend for breakfast, at least not every day of their vacation. An a la carte breakfast might also generate greater patronage to the dining facilities of the hotel which I observed to be quite empty. We did like the hotel and would certainly consider staying there again. I would rate the hotel as 4+, but not quite 5-star.
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and stay here I have to start with a must - you must, must, must dine at this hotel even if you don't stay here. Right, you say, who dines at their hotel when they stay in Madid?! Let me tell you, that's what we thought - but got so tired one day from all the sights that just decided to stay in and try the restaurant at the hotel. What a party for our tastebuds! We were blown away - and both of us are restaurant snobs, very demanding re both the quality and the service. I can't rave enough about this place - the foie gras was just heavenly, the fish was flavorful, sumptuous sauce choice, one of the best meals we had in Europe!Now, on to the hotel - all the reviews are true, this is very good choice, right across the Retiro park, which is very pleasant for an evening stroll (something akin the Central Park in NY). It's in this white palace, but everything inside is ultra modern and chick. We took the inside room, and were very pleased with quiteness at night. Couldn't hear any other guests, so my worries about thin walls in European hotels were all for nothing. Very private, good location (walk to Prado and other museums), great service, this is deffinitely an alternative to both the Ritz and the Westin (which are in the same neighbourhood).

Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel AC Retiro Fantastic hotel...large rooms..great service..great bathrooms...walking distance to the Prado Museum. The restaurant in the hotel is excellent. High ceilings and hardwood floors great hotel.

Reviews.Content: Excellente My husband and I have just returned from five days in Madrid. We have visited the city many times before but this was the best hotel we've stayed in. The hotel only opened in November 2004 and although located in an old building the rooms are very modern with flat screen TVs on the wall and CD players. The bathroom was equally impressive. Everything was spotless and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is right across the street from the park so the location is perfect. We can't wait to return. We definitely won't be staying anywhere else in Madrid from now on!
